docs.snippet: David Moyes admitted he was "very happy" after overseeing his maiden victory as Real Sociedad coach before criticising the Spanish referee for what the Scot suggested was excessive zeal....

headline.main: Moyes Critical of 'Overzealous' Referee After Debut Win
headline.print_headline: Moyes Critical of 'Overzealous' Referee After Debut Win

docs.lead_paragraph: David Moyes admitted he was "very happy" after overseeing his maiden victory as Real Sociedad coach before criticising the Spanish referee for what the Scot suggested was excessive zeal.

docs.snippet: Pope Francis stood Saturday for two minutes of silent prayer facing east in one of Turkey's most important mosques, a powerful vision of Christian-Muslim understanding at a time when neighboring countries are experiencing violent Islamic assault o...

headline.main: Pope Prays in Istanbul Mosque in New Outreach
headline.print_headline: Pope Prays in Istanbul Mosque in New Outreach

docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis stood Saturday for two minutes of silent prayer facing east in one of Turkey's most important mosques, a powerful vision of Christian-Muslim understanding at a time when neighboring countries are experiencing violent Islamic assault on Christians and religious minorities.

docs.snippet: The Ferguson police officer who fatally shot 18-year-old Michael Brown resigned Saturday, and protests intensified in the St. Louis suburb where violence erupted earlier this week when a grand jury decided not to indict him....

headline.main: Officer Who Shot Michael Brown Resigns in Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Officer Who Shot Michael Brown Resigns in Ferguson

docs.lead_paragraph: The Ferguson police officer who fatally shot 18-year-old Michael Brown resigned Saturday, and protests intensified in the St. Louis suburb where violence erupted earlier this week when a grand jury decided not to indict him.

docs.snippet: India's home minister hit out at Pakistan on Saturday, accusing its state agencies of using terror to try to destabilize India, and rejecting Pakistan's assertion that non-state actors are involved in terrorism....

headline.main: India: Pakistani Agencies Backing Terror Groups
headline.print_headline: India: Pakistani Agencies Backing Terror Groups

docs.lead_paragraph: India's home minister hit out at Pakistan on Saturday, accusing its state agencies of using terror to try to destabilize India, and rejecting Pakistan's assertion that non-state actors are involved in terrorism.

docs.snippet: The first test between Australia and India has been postponed to allow his team mates to mourn the death of Phillip Hughes at his funeral on Wednesday, Cricket Australia (CA) said on Saturday....

headline.main: India Test Postponed After Hughes Funeral Set
headline.print_headline: India Test Postponed After Hughes Funeral Set

docs.lead_paragraph: The first test between Australia and India has been postponed to allow his team mates to mourn the death of Phillip Hughes at his funeral on Wednesday, Cricket Australia (CA) said on Saturday.

docs.snippet: The white police officer who fatally shot an unarmed black teenager in a St. Louis suburb has resigned, his lawyer said on Saturday, as activists set out on a 120-mile (193-km) march to protest the killing and a grand jury's decision not to indict...

headline.main: Ferguson Police Officer Who Killed Black Teen Resigns From Force
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Police Officer Who Killed Black Teen Resigns From Force

docs.lead_paragraph: The white police officer who fatally shot an unarmed black teenager in a St. Louis suburb has resigned, his lawyer said on Saturday, as activists set out on a 120-mile (193-km) march to protest the killing and a grand jury's decision not to indict him.

docs.snippet: Twickenham, the home of English rugby, has banned two fans for two years for homophobic abuse aimed at gay Welsh referee Nigel Owens at a recent international against New Zealand....

headline.main: Twickenham Bans Fans for Homophobic Abuse of Referee
headline.print_headline: Twickenham Bans Fans for Homophobic Abuse of Referee

docs.lead_paragraph: Twickenham, the home of English rugby, has banned two fans for two years for homophobic abuse aimed at gay Welsh referee Nigel Owens at a recent international against New Zealand.

docs.snippet: American Jordan Spieth shot a two-under-par 69 for a share of a one-stroke lead with locals Greg Chalmers and Brett Rumford after blustery conditions caused chaos in the third round of the Australian Open on Saturday....

headline.print_headline: Spieth Shares Lead After McIlroy Blows Up in Sydney

docs.lead_paragraph: American Jordan Spieth shot a two-under-par 69 for a share of a one-stroke lead with locals Greg Chalmers and Brett Rumford after blustery conditions caused chaos in the third round of the Australian Open on Saturday.

docs.snippet: After last year’s mediocre season, Southampton F.C. officials and fans feared this season would be worse, but despite the off-season turmoil the team’s results have been impressive....

headline.main: Team Sells Its Best Players, and Doesn’t Pay for It
headline.print_headline: Team Sells Its Best Players, and Doesn’t Pay for It
headline.seo: A Rebuilt Southampton Excels With a ‘10th-Place Budget’

docs.abstract: Southampton is second in English soccer's Premier League despite having sold several of its top players during off-season.
docs.lead_paragraph: After last year’s mediocre season, Southampton F.C. officials and fans feared this season would be worse, but despite the off-season turmoil the team’s results have been impressive.
